original: 'du byed la ni skyabs su shes par bya //
analyzed: 'du byed la ni skyabs su shes par bya //
translated: One should understand that formations are a refuge.üîΩBecause the yogin becomes disenchanted with all conditioned things, he understands that they are not a refuge.

original: zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir 'dus byas ma lus pa la rnal 'byor pa sems skyo bar 'gyur ba de dag skyabs kyi phyir rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mkhyen nas sdug bsngal las yongs su bsrung ba'i don la skyabs kyi don du gsungs pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir 'dus byas ma lus pa la rnal 'byor pa sems skyo bar 'gyur ba de dag skyabs kyi phyir rtog pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mkhyen nas sdug bsngal las yongs su bsrung ba'i don la skyabs kyi don du gsungs pa
translated: He understands that the meaning of refuge is the meaning of protection from suffering,

original: yin te / 'dus byas kun sdug bsngal ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / 'dus byas kun sdug bsngal ma lus pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sems can chags pa med par gyur na nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When beings become free from attachment, they are liberated from the bondage of the defilements.

original: skyo nas su zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan yon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyo nas su zhes bya ba 'dis ni phan yon bstan pa yin no //
translated: The line having become disenchanted with... indicates the benefit.

original: mya ngan 'da' zhes bya ba ni phun po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'o //üîΩci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' zhes bya ba ni phun po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su'o // ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: Having become disenchanted with the world, he attains nirvana in the realm of nirvana that is not a place of sorrow, but rather a place of abundance.

original: skyo nas su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyo nas su zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What does he do? The line having become disenchanted with... and so on.

original: srid par 'gro ba ste ji srid pa'i rnam pa las skyo bar gyur pa'o //üîΩskyo ba las lha dang mi rnams la chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: srid par 'gro ba ste ji srid pa'i rnam pa las skyo bar gyur pa'o // skyo ba las lha dang mi rnams la chags pa med pa ste /
translated: He becomes disenchanted with the world, that is, with the various forms of existence.

original: 'ching ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ching ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become disenchanted, he becomes free from attachment to gods and humans, and so he becomes unfettered.

original: me lta bu zhes bya ba la me lce gang la yod pa de ni me lce can te me yin no //
analyzed: me lta bu zhes bya ba la me lce gang la yod pa de ni me lce can te me yin no //
translated: The line like a flame means that he is like a flame.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /

original: ji ltar me bud shing zhes bya ba'i rgyu yongs su zad na zhi bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i rgyu yongs su zad pa na dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das 'di skad du 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das 'di skad du 'di lta ste /

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba de yod na khyad par de yod pa med na med par 'gyur ro //

original: lud la sogs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: lud la sogs pa lta bu ste /

translated: The phrase ‚Äúwe will apply ourselves‚Äù means that we will apply ourselves to the practice of the path.

original: shing drung zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shing drung ngam thibs po dang bcas pa'i sa phyogs su yang dag par gnas pas so //
analyzed: shing drung zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shing drung ngam thibs po dang bcas pa'i sa phyogs su yang dag par gnas pas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúat the foot of a tree‚Äù and so on means that we will dwell in a place that is at the foot of a tree or in a place that is overgrown with trees.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems las bskyed pa ni rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems bskyed pa'am mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i sems las bskyed pa ni rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la sems bskyed pa'am mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwe will generate the mind that is set on attaining nirvana‚Äù means that we will generate the mind that is set on attaining nirvana, or we will actualize nirvana, which is the complete abandonment of all the mental afflictions, by means of our own direct realization.

original: bag med ma mdzad ces bya ba ni mchog tu bag med par ma gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: bag med ma mdzad ces bya ba ni mchog tu bag med par ma gyur cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwe will not be heedless‚Äù means that we will not be extremely heedless.

original: goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi ming las 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi ming las 'bod pa'o //
translated: Gautama is a name derived from his clan.

original: bsgoms zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed pa'o //üîΩzhi ba'i go 'phang la reg gyur //
analyzed: bsgoms zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma spang bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed pa'o // zhi ba'i go 'phang la reg gyur //
translated: Meditating means striving to eliminate the remaining afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i ye shes kyis bden pa bzhi'i go 'phang mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i ye shes kyis bden pa bzhi'i go 'phang mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He touched the state of peace means that through the wisdom of no-more-learning, he saw the state of the four noble truths.

original: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas sems dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi bya ba byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi dran pa nyung zad kyang med pa de'i phyir dran pa nyams pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas sems dbang du byas pa nyid kyi phyir rang gi bya ba byed pa'i ngang tshul can gyi dran pa nyung zad kyang med pa de'i phyir dran pa nyams pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because his mind was controlled by such thoughts as desire, he had no mindfulness whatsoever that was inclined to do what should be done. Therefore, it says his mindfulness declined.

original: snga phyi dran pa'i dus dang bral ba srid pa'i rgyud de /
analyzed: snga phyi dran pa'i dus dang bral ba srid pa'i rgyud de /
translated: He was devoid of the time of remembering the past and future, and he was in the stream of existence.

original: sems kyi rgyud gang la yod pa de ni srid pa'i rgyud can gyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gang la yod pa de ni srid pa'i rgyud can gyi zhes bya'o //
translated: The stream of existence means the stream of mind. He who has that is called one who is in the stream of existence.

original: seng ge'i khri'i steng du snam sbyar bting ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang mdo sde'i sde snod smra ba po de la mchod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri'i steng du snam sbyar bting ba ni bcom ldan 'das dang mdo sde'i sde snod smra ba po de la mchod par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The lion throne is covered with a woolen cloth in order to honor the Blessed One and the speaker of the Sutra Pitaka.

original: mi g-yo ba ni mi ldeg pa ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni mi ldeg pa ste /
translated: Unwavering means not moving.

original: rgya mtsho zab mo yang yin la mi g-yo ba yang de yin pas na rgya mtsho zab mo mi g-yo ba lta bu'i 'khor rnams yin la /
analyzed: rgya mtsho zab mo yang yin la mi g-yo ba yang de yin pas na rgya mtsho zab mo mi g-yo ba lta bu'i 'khor rnams yin la /
translated: Since it is a deep ocean and it is also unwavering, the retinue is like a deep ocean that is unwavering.

original: 'dir yon tan gyi sgo nas zab pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yon tan gyi sgo nas zab pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that it is deep in terms of qualities.

original: chos 'jig rten gsum gyis mchod cing rjed ces bya ba la 'jig rten gsum ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'jig rten nam mi dang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang // gzugs na spyod pa'i lha nyid dam /
analyzed: chos 'jig rten gsum gyis mchod cing rjed ces bya ba la 'jig rten gsum ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'jig rten nam mi dang 'dod pa na spyod pa dang // gzugs na spyod pa'i lha nyid dam /
translated: The Dharma is worshipped and revered by the three worlds. The three worlds are the worlds of desire, form, and formlessness, or humans, desire realm gods, and form realm gods.

original: mi dang klu dang lha'i 'jig rten dag yin no //
analyzed: mi dang klu dang lha'i 'jig rten dag yin no //
translated: Or, it is the worlds of humans, nagas, and gods.

original: khyed rnams zhes bya ba ni khyed rnams kyi nang nas gang gus par nyan pa de dag bsams shing mngon par 'dod pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyed rnams zhes bya ba ni khyed rnams kyi nang nas gang gus par nyan pa de dag bsams shing mngon par 'dod pa'i bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those of you means that those of you who listen with devotion will have the happiness that is desired and intended.

original: shin tu bde ba nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba las snying po'i mchog ces bstan to //üîΩrtag pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba nyid yin pa'i phyir brtan pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu bde ba nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba las snying po'i mchog ces bstan to // rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba nyid yin pa'i phyir brtan pa ste /
translated: The word essence is used because of the highest happiness, and the word supreme is used because of the happiness of cyclic existence.

original: gcig tu brten cing gsal ba'o //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyi yul la dran pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: gcig tu brten cing gsal ba'o // bcom ldan 'das kyi yul la dran pa ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: The word permanent is used because of the happiness of nirvana, and the word firm is used because of the single firm basis.üîΩThe word pervading is used because of the pervading of all directions.

original: des sgrib pa dang bral ba'i yid rab @224a * //üîΩtu sad pa gang la yod pa de ni yid sad par byed pa can no //
analyzed: des sgrib pa dang bral ba'i yid rab @224a * // tu sad pa gang la yod pa de ni yid sad par byed pa can no //
translated: The word awakening is used because of the awakening of the mind that is free from obscurations.

original: khyab pa ni phyogs rnam par khyab par byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: khyab pa ni phyogs rnam par khyab par byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: The word pervading is used because of the pervading of all directions.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'phags pa kun dga' bos mdo sde de ni 'di skad du yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di skad ces bya ba ni 'phags pa kun dga' bos mdo sde de ni 'di skad du yin gyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: Thus have I heard refers to the words of the sutra, which are thus, not otherwise, as the noble Ananda ascertained.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i go rims dang bdag gis thos pa'i go rims gang yin pa de nyid kyis da ltar ston par byed kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i go rims dang bdag gis thos pa'i go rims gang yin pa de nyid kyis da ltar ston par byed kyi rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: I teach them in the same order in which they were taught by the Lord and in which I heard them, not in some other order.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bzung ba ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bzung ba ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: I heard refers to the teacher who directly received the teaching.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i zhal nas zhes mngon sum du thos pa dang ldan pa'i dge slong dag las mngon sum du gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyi thad dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i zhal nas zhes mngon sum du thos pa dang ldan pa'i dge slong dag las mngon sum du gzung ba yin no //
translated: He directly received it from the Lord and from the mouths of the Well-Gone Ones, and from the monks who had directly received the teaching.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa dag chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu cha shas dang bcas pa bcom ldan 'das kyi thad las mngon du gzung ba dang / gnyis pa dge slong dag las zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa dag chos kyi phung po stong phrag brgyad cu cha shas dang bcas pa bcom ldan 'das kyi thad las mngon du gzung ba dang / gnyis pa dge slong dag las zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: As the noble ƒÄnanda declared: ‚ÄúVenerable ones, the eight thousand sections of the Dharma-aggregate were directly received by me from the Blessed One, and a second time from the monks.‚Äù

original: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i bya ba tsam gyi sgo nas mdo sde 'dzin par nus pa ston pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa zhes bya ba ni rna ba'i bya ba tsam gyi sgo nas mdo sde 'dzin par nus pa ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHeard‚Äù shows that he is able to retain the s≈´tras by means of the mere activity of the ear.

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni grangs gcig tu 'chad pa'i 'dus ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba ni grangs gcig tu 'chad pa'i 'dus ston par byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAt one time‚Äù is the assembly of the expounder.

original: gcig tu zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gcig tu zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to ‚Äúat one time‚Äù is the same.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthe Blessed One‚Äù and so on is the same as before.

original: gzir ba ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa mtshon cha la sogs pas lus la bsnun par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzir ba ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa mtshon cha la sogs pas lus la bsnun par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfflicted‚Äù means that the body is struck by weapons and so on that cause suffering.

original: rma byung ba ni rnam par bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: rma byung ba ni rnam par bsnun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWounded‚Äù means struck.

original: ngan du brjod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ngan pa zhes bya ba de skad du ston par byed pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i tshig de nyid ni brjod pa yin pa de'i phyir du ba'i sgra mi snyan pa mthon po 'byin par byed
analyzed: ngan du brjod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ngan pa zhes bya ba de skad du ston par byed pa'i tshig brjod pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i tshig de nyid ni brjod pa yin pa de'i phyir du ba'i sgra mi snyan pa mthon po 'byin par byed
translated: Therefore, the words that are used to express it are the words that are used to express it.

original: pa'o // khyad par med ces bya ba ni bdag gis yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa 'di la de dag sdang bar mi bya'o snyam pa'i ltos pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o // khyad par med ces bya ba ni bdag gis yon tan khyad par du 'phags pa 'di la de dag sdang bar mi bya'o snyam pa'i ltos pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Without distinction‚Äù means that one should not be hostile to them with regard to this excellent quality of mine.

original: bla na med pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan rin po che'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni rin chen gter yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan rin po che'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni rin chen gter yin no //
translated: The Blessed One is a treasure of jewels because he is the very basis of the jewels of the unsurpassed ten powers and so on.

original: yon tan rgya mtsho ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa yon tan gyi rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho ni bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa yon tan gyi rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The ocean of good qualities refers to the ocean of good qualities such as the unsurpassed factors of wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'grel pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering, etc. The commentary should be understood as before.

original: mi lha lha min klu'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni chos dang bla na @224b med pa'i phan gdags pas 'jig rten dga' bar mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mi la sogs pa'i rgyal po yin te de'o //üîΩzhi bar gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ci 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'am /üîΩ'on te 'tshe ba med par dgos pa bsgrubs te phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su bcom ldan 'das rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi lha lha min klu'i rgyal po zhes bya ba ni chos dang bla na @224b med pa'i phan gdags pas 'jig rten dga' bar mdzad pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das mi la sogs pa'i rgyal po yin te de'o // zhi bar gshegs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ci 'tsho bar 'gyur ba'am / 'on te 'tshe ba med par dgos pa bsgrubs te phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su bcom ldan 'das rab tu zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The kings of men, gods, demigods, and nagas are the Blessed One, because he delights the world with the Dharma and unsurpassed benefit.

original: zhi ba ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: zhi ba ni zhi ba ste /
translated: The Blessed One has gone to peace, etc.  To peace means to the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates, having accomplished the purpose without harm.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: Or, peace means to the realm of nirvana with remainder of aggregates.üîΩThe Blessed One has gone to the peace of nirvana, having accomplished the purpose without harm.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas stong pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo ma lus pa mkhyen pa'i ston pas stong pa mthong na rmongs pa 'tsho ba la brtan par byed pa 'ga' zhig snying po'i 'du shes nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas stong pa zhes bya ba ni skye bo ma lus pa mkhyen pa'i ston pas stong pa mthong na rmongs pa 'tsho ba la brtan par byed pa 'ga' zhig snying po'i 'du shes nye bar 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Omniscient One said empty means that when the Teacher who knows all things sees emptiness, some people who are confused about the meaning of life will think that it is nihilism.

original: 'di ltar dngos po che ge mo zhig bdag gis shes par bya'o snyam pa'i smon pa'i sems bzhag nas don de shes pa ni smon lam gyi ye shes yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po che ge mo zhig bdag gis shes par bya'o snyam pa'i smon pa'i sems bzhag nas don de shes pa ni smon lam gyi ye shes yin no //
translated: The knowledge of what one wishes to know is the knowledge of what one wishes to know, thinking I will know such and such a thing.

original: dgag pa ni mngon sum du zlog pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa ni mngon sum du zlog pa'o //
translated: Negation is the direct reversal.

original: phyir gshe ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i skyon no //üîΩmi mthun pa'i smra ba ni bzlog pa med pa'am /
analyzed: phyir gshe ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'i skyon no // mi mthun pa'i smra ba ni bzlog pa med pa'am /
translated: Criticism is a hidden fault.

original: bzlog pa'i don du ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i don du ston pa'o //
translated: Disagreement is the absence of reversal, or the teaching for the sake of reversal.

original: 'di ni chos so zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos so zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is the taught Dharma.

original: 'dul ba ni nyon mongs ba spang ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni nyon mongs ba spang ba'i thabs su gyur pa'o //
translated: Discipline is the means for abandoning afflictions.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ste /
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ste /
translated: The Teacher's teaching is the BhagavƒÅn's word.

original: spong bar byed pa rigs kyi man ngag ston pa'o //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa rigs kyi man ngag ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the instructions of the spiritual lineage is the means of eliminating.

original: rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dbyangs zhum pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir dbyangs zhum pa med pa'o //
translated: The word clearly means that the voice is not faint, because of the absence of fear.

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po lnga la sdug bsngal gyi sgras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'bras bur gyur pa'i phung po lnga la sdug bsngal gyi sgras bstan pa yin no //
translated: The five aggregates that are the effect are indicated by the word suffering in the phrase the truth of suffering, etc.

original: 'phags pa rnams la bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la bden pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The word truth means that which is not deceptive, because it is the object of the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyur gyur ba'i phung po lnga ni kun 'byung yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ji lta ba bzhin du gzigs pa'i phyir ro // rgyur gyur ba'i phung po lnga ni kun 'byung yin te /
translated: The word noble means that which is not common to the philosophers, because it is the object of the knowledge of the noble ones.

original: 'di la sdug bsngal 'byung bas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la sdug bsngal 'byung bas na zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five aggregates that are the cause are the origin, because it is said, Because suffering originates from this.

original: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pas na 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pas na 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the five aggregates that are suffering is the truth of cessation, because it is said, Because suffering ceases.

original: 'gog par 'gro bar byed cing thob par byed pa'i phyir 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: 'gog par 'gro bar byed cing thob par byed pa'i phyir 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ste /
translated: The path that leads to cessation and causes its attainment is the truth of the path, because it is said, Because it is the path.

original: lam gyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yin no //
translated: It is the truth of the path.

original: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du bstan to //
translated: Birth, etc., are taught to be suffering because they are the cause of suffering.

original: srid pa ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: srid pa ni chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Existence is characterized by attachment.

original: yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa'i ni yang srid pa can no //üîΩde ma thag pa'i skye bo la mngon par dga' zhing mngon pa 'dod @225a * //
analyzed: yang srid dang rjes su mthun pa'i ni yang srid pa can no // de ma thag pa'i skye bo la mngon par dga' zhing mngon pa 'dod @225a * //
translated: One who is in accordance with existence is one who has existence.

original: pa'i phyir dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'o //
translated: One who is delighted with and desires the immediate birth is one who is accompanied by the delight and attachment of existence.

original: yul thams cad la mngon par dga' ba'i ngang tshul can ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba can no //
analyzed: yul thams cad la mngon par dga' ba'i ngang tshul can ni de dang der mngon par dga' ba can no //
translated: One who has the nature of delighting in all objects is one who delights in this and that.

original: ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bco lnga la mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni ma lus par
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bco lnga la mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni ma lus par
translated: As for the phrase ‚Äúcomplete abandonment,‚Äù etc., the nirvana of one who has entered the path of vision in the fifteen moments for the purpose of manifesting the fruit of stream-entry is called ‚Äúcomplete abandonment.‚Äù

original: spangs pa zhes bya bar bstan te /
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya bar bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshigs lan cig spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshigs lan cig spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the passions to be abandoned by the path of insight are all abandoned at one time.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par btang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par btang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The Nirvana of the Streamwinner is called ‚Äúrenunciation‚Äù

original: de yang spang bar bya ba mi srid pas nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang spang bar bya ba mi srid pas nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain, since it is impossible to abandon it again.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni spangs pa'i dngos po yin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni spangs pa'i dngos po yin te /
translated: The fruit of the once-returner is the ‚Äústate of abandonment‚Äù for one who has entered into the realization of the fruit of the once-returner,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rgya che ba shin tu smad par bya ba slob par byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rgya che ba shin tu smad par bya ba slob par byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the vast and extremely reprehensible passions of the realm of desire are made into something abandoned.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa yin te /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa yin te /
translated: The Nirvana of the once-returner is ‚Äúexhaustion‚Äù

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the passions of the realm of desire are abandoned.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: That nirvana in which one has entered for the sake of realizing the result of a non-returner is freedom from passion.

original: de thob bar gyur na 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob bar gyur na 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one has attained that, one is free from passion for the desire realm.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa yin te /
translated: That nirvana in which one is a non-returner is cessation,

original: yang 'dod pa'i khams su 'ong ba'i 'ching ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rlung gi chu 'gog pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yang 'dod pa'i khams su 'ong ba'i 'ching ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rlung gi chu 'gog pa lta bu'o //
translated: because there is no cause for bondage to return to the desire realm, like a dam blocking water.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par zhi ba ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par zhi ba ste /
translated: That nirvana in which one has entered for the sake of realizing the result of an arhat is complete peace,

original: nyes pa ma lus pa spangs pa gcig tu zhi ba dang thag nye bar gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ma lus pa spangs pa gcig tu zhi ba dang thag nye bar gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is close to the complete peace of abandoning all faults.

original: dgra bcom pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni nub pa yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni nub pa yin te /
translated: That nirvana in which one is an arhat is disappearance,üîΩbecause there is no cause for the arising of the aggregates.

original: de thob pa na kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad nub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thob pa na kun du sbyor ba dang 'ching ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal thams cad nub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When that is attained, all the fetters, bonds, entanglements of the secondary mental afflictions, and latent propensities are extinguished.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang lam gyi yan lag zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang lam gyi yan lag zag pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: Right view and so on are also reality because they are the uncontaminated branches of the path.

original: thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang lhag mar ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dis lhag ma med par spangs pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang lhag mar ma byas pa nyid kyi phyir 'dis lhag ma med par spangs pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot a method‚Äù indicates that the path of cultivation is the relinquishment of all remaining mental afflictions because it does not allow even a single form of mental affliction to remain.üîΩThe passage that begins with the words ‚ÄúMonks, form is not the self‚Äù indicates that the self does not exist as a real entity.

original: dge slong dag gzugs bdag ma yin zhes @225b bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang dbang ma yin zhing gtso bo ma yin zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs bdag ma yin zhes @225b bya ba la sogs pa la bdag ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang dbang ma yin zhing gtso bo ma yin zhes bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúis not the self‚Äù means that it is not independent and is not the principal factor.

original: gal te de rang dbang du gyur pa yin na ni gnod pa'am gdung ba'i don dang gdung ba'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de rang dbang du gyur pa yin na ni gnod pa'am gdung ba'i don dang gdung ba'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were independent, it would not be subject to harm or injury, nor would it be the basis for harm or injury.

original: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig rang dbang gi blo dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid la gnod pa'i phyir brtson par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'ga' zhig rang dbang gi blo dang ldan pa'i bdag nyid la gnod pa'i phyir brtson par mi byed do //
translated: Because no one would strive to harm himself if he were an independent self.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu mtshan te /
translated: The expression ‚Äúsuffering‚Äù refers to the cause of suffering.

original: phyi rol gyi sdug bsngal mngon sum du bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sdug bsngal mngon sum du bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the suffering that is experienced externally.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar thob par byed nus par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni de ltar thob par byed nus par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúto obtain‚Äù means to be able to obtain it in this way.

original: gzugs la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang 'brel pa 'di thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang 'brel pa 'di thob pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúin form‚Äù means to obtain it in relation to form.

original: 'di lta bur zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: 'di lta bur zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'am /
translated: The expression ‚Äúsuch as this‚Äù means to obtain it in relation to beauty, etc.,

original: bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: or to obtain it in relation to the cause of pleasure.

original: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i nyes pa mi bzad pa'am sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bur ma gyur cig ces bya ba ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i nyes pa mi bzad pa'am sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúmay it not be such as this‚Äù means to obtain it in relation to the cause of the unbearable misfortune of what is not desired or the cause of suffering.

original: bdag rang rgyud nyid yin pa'i phyir rang rgyud du shes pa yin na bdag nyid kyis nyes pa bzod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag rang rgyud nyid yin pa'i phyir rang rgyud du shes pa yin na bdag nyid kyis nyes pa bzod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since the self is the very continuum of the aggregates, it is understood to be a continuum. But the self would not tolerate the misfortune of itself.

original: gang gi phyir gzugs bdag ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa ji srid du las kyis 'phangs par gyur pa'i rnam pa de srid du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs bdag ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa ji srid du las kyis 'phangs par gyur pa'i rnam pa de srid du rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because form is not the self, therefore it follows that as long as the form is projected by karma, for that long it will follow.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa las legs par rnam par phye ba'i phyir yang 'dir rnam par dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bshad pa ni mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo'i rnam par bshad pa las legs par rnam par phye ba'i phyir yang 'dir rnam par dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: The explanation beginning with ‚ÄúWhat do you think, monks?‚Äù should not be analyzed here, because it has been well analyzed in the commentary on the Descent into the Womb Sutra.

original: 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar len pa med ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dngos po cung zad khas mi len cing bdag nyid du 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten cung zad kyang nye bar len pa med ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa dngos po cung zad khas mi len cing bdag nyid du 'dzin pa med do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe world does not take up anything at all‚Äù means that the world does not accept any thing and does not grasp it as its own.

original: yongs su gdung ba med ces bya ba ni yongs su gdung bar mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med ces bya ba ni yongs su gdung bar mi byed pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not burn‚Äù means it does not cause burning.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par ma gyur pa las yid mi bde ba skyes par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir yongs su gdung ba yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub par ma gyur pa las yid mi bde ba skyes par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir yongs su gdung ba yin la /
translated: Here, burning is the mental dissatisfaction that arises from the non-fulfillment of a desired goal.

original: de yang dngos po thams cad bdag med pa nyid du bzung ba'i phyir dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang chags pa mi skye la /
analyzed: de yang dngos po thams cad bdag med pa nyid du bzung ba'i phyir dngos po 'ga' zhig la yang chags pa mi skye la /
translated: Moreover, because all things are apprehended as being selfless, attachment does not arise toward any thing.

original: chags pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i phyir yongs su gdung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because there is no attachment, there is no torment.

original: de bas bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang rig pas mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bas bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rang rig pas mngon sum du mthong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I myself will attain nirvana. This is seen by direct perception through self-awareness.

original: rnam pa gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the aspect?

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is stated as ‚Äúmy births are exhausted,‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i rnam par bshad pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par bshad pa yang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Its explanation is the same as before.

original: 'dul ba'i gleng gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la @226a * //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i gleng gzhi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la @226a * //
translated: The chapter on the origin of the Vinaya, and so on.

original: gleng gzhi ni yul 'ga' zhig tu bslab pa'i gzhi 'di 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni yul 'ga' zhig tu bslab pa'i gzhi 'di 'byung ba'o //
translated: The origin is the arising of this training precept in some place.

original: 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa nges pa'i skabs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa nges pa'i skabs so //
translated: Arising is the occasion of determining afflictions, and so on.

original: sha ma thabs ni 'og tu bgo ba yin la mtho ba dang dma' ba kun nas spangs pa nyid kyi phyir zlum pa ni yongs su zlum pa'o //
analyzed: sha ma thabs ni 'og tu bgo ba yin la mtho ba dang dma' ba kun nas spangs pa nyid kyi phyir zlum pa ni yongs su zlum pa'o //
translated: The lower robe is worn below, and since it is completely free from being high or low, it is round, that is, completely round.

original: chos gos ni stod du bgo ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos ni stod du bgo ba'o //
translated: The upper robe is worn above.

original: 'di ni bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par gzhag pa ni bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bslab pa'i gzhi rnam par gzhag pa ni bcas pa yin no //
translated: This is a rule, etc. The establishment of the bases of training is a rule.

original: bcas pa smos pas dge slong 'di tsam gyi mdun du nyes pa spom po bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa smos pas dge slong 'di tsam gyi mdun du nyes pa spom po bshags par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang bsdus pa yin no //
translated: By mentioning the rule, it also includes statements such as, ‚ÄúThis much of a fault should be confessed in the presence of this much of a monk.‚Äù

original: sngon rjes su gnang ba'i dngos po gang yin pa bkag pa dang / gang sngon bkag pa yang rjes su gnang ba yang rjes su bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: sngon rjes su gnang ba'i dngos po gang yin pa bkag pa dang / gang sngon bkag pa yang rjes su gnang ba yang rjes su bcas pa yin te /
translated: Any previously permitted thing that is prohibited, and any previously prohibited thing that is permitted, is a subsequent rule.

original: dpen na mchil lham rjes su gnang ba mdzad nas de nyid kyi bye brag bkag pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dpen na mchil lham rjes su gnang ba mdzad nas de nyid kyi bye brag bkag pa mdzad de /
translated: For example, after permitting sandals, he prohibited a specific type of them.

original: thug thug zer ba dang / thrig thrig zer ba bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba de dag yang bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: thug thug zer ba dang / thrig thrig zer ba bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba de dag yang bkag pa yin la /
translated: The prohibition of the above is a permission,üîΩand the permission is a prohibition,

original: bkag pa yang rjes su gnang ba ni dper na dus ma yin pa'i zas sngar bkag pa las nad pa la yang rjes su gnang ba mdzad pa 'di yang rjes su gnang ba yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bkag pa yang rjes su gnang ba ni dper na dus ma yin pa'i zas sngar bkag pa las nad pa la yang rjes su gnang ba mdzad pa 'di yang rjes su gnang ba yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as untimely eating is first prohibited and then permitted for the sick.

original: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po ni srog la thug kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du dngos po ni srog la thug kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dgag pa yin te /
translated: In all cases, one should not engage in an action even at the cost of one‚Äôs life.üîΩThis is a prohibition,

original: dper na nga la ston par 'dzin pa dag gis tha na chang rtsva'i mchog mas kyang btung bar mi bya zhing sbyin par mi bya ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gcig tu bya ba ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nga la ston par 'dzin pa dag gis tha na chang rtsva'i mchog mas kyang btung bar mi bya zhing sbyin par mi bya ba dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gcig tu bya ba ma yin pa nyid du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as it is said that those who hold me as their teacher should not drink alcohol even as much as a drop on a blade of grass, should not give it, and should not kill and so on, which are naturally reprehensible and not to be done.

original: gang bya ba 'ga' zhig la 'dod pas 'jug pa'i yul rjes su gnang ba yang bya ba ma yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gang bya ba 'ga' zhig la 'dod pas 'jug pa'i yul rjes su gnang ba yang bya ba ma yin pa 'am /
translated: It is also the permission to engage in some action out of desire for the object.

original: bya ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The object that is permitted by the desire to engage in some action is not a fault called ‚Äúthe misdeed of action.‚Äù

original: dper na phyir rgol ba tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi bstan bcos bklag par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyir rgol ba tshar gcad par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi bstan bcos bklag par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the statement, ‚ÄúOne should read the non-Buddhist treatises in order to refute opponents.‚Äù

original: zab mo'i don khong du chud pa'i nus pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir shes rab zhan pa ste /
analyzed: zab mo'i don khong du chud pa'i nus pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir shes rab zhan pa ste /
translated: They are of weak understanding because they lack the ability to comprehend the profound meaning.

original: shes bya'i dngos po phyi rol na yod pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de dag ni shes rab zhan pa can zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po phyi rol na yod pa'i shes rab gang la yod pa de dag ni shes rab zhan pa can zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who have the understanding of external objects of knowledge are called ‚Äúthose of weak understanding,‚Äù because they are taken as the basis.

original: don la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yi ge tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: don la ltos pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yi ge tsam gyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes smos so //
translated: They are said to ‚Äúfollow mere words‚Äù because they do not rely on the meaning.

original: don zab mo la mos pa zhes @226b bya ba ni don zab mo khong du chud par 'dod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: don zab mo la mos pa zhes @226b bya ba ni don zab mo khong du chud par 'dod pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFaith in the profound‚Äù means having the desire to comprehend the profound meaning.

original: ma lta bu ni chos mngon pa ste /
analyzed: ma lta bu ni chos mngon pa ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is like a mother.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i sde snod dag gi don 'chad pa'i sgo nas ma lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i sde snod dag gi don 'chad pa'i sgo nas ma lta bu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is like a mother because it explains the meaning of the scriptural collections of the sutras and the Vinaya.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i don yang dag par bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i don yang dag par bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is for the purpose of preserving the meaning of the sutras and the Vinaya.

original: mdo sde dang 'dul ba ni don gyi sgo nas chos mngon par yang dag par 'dus pa de nyid kyi phyir de bsdus pas mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i don yang dag par bsdus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba ni don gyi sgo nas chos mngon par yang dag par 'dus pa de nyid kyi phyir de bsdus pas mdo sde dang 'dul ba'i don yang dag par bsdus par 'gyur ro //
translated: The sutras and the Vinaya are included in the Abhidharma in terms of their meaning. Therefore, by including the Abhidharma, the meaning of the sutras and the Vinaya is also included.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni shes par bya ba yin pas na shes bya yin la /
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni shes par bya ba yin pas na shes bya yin la /
translated: The characteristics of the knowable are the characteristics of the objects of knowledge.

original: de nyid mtshan nyid yin pa de bas na chos mngon par rab tu bsgrags pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid mtshan nyid yin pa de bas na chos mngon par rab tu bsgrags pa ste /
translated: The Abhidharma is proclaimed because it is the characteristics of the knowable.

original: rab tu gsal bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmdo sde ni dgongs pa ston pa yin la /
analyzed: rab tu gsal bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mdo sde ni dgongs pa ston pa yin la /
translated: It is said that it is proclaimed because it is made clear.üîΩThe sutras teach the intention.

original: 'dul ba ni 'byung ba ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dul ba ni 'byung ba ston pa yin te /
translated: The Vinaya teaches the origin.

original: dgongs pa ni bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni bsams pa yin no //
translated: Intention is thought.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin ni lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin ni lus dang tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are mindfulness of the body, of sensation, of thought, and of the factors.üîΩThe four right efforts are:üîΩto generate zeal for the production of good things that are not yet produced;

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed /üîΩbrtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir 'dun pa skyed par byed / brtson 'grus rtsom par byed /
translated: to exert oneself for the production of good things that are not yet produced;

original: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin par byed do //
translated: to hold the mind firmly for the production of good things that are not yet produced;üîΩto generate zeal for the non-production of evil things that are not yet produced;üîΩto exert oneself for the non-production of evil things that are not yet produced;üîΩto hold the mind firmly for the non-production of evil things that are not yet produced;üîΩto generate zeal for the abandonment of evil things that are already produced;

translated: The term absence of conflict is used for arhats who know that sentient beings are suffering due to affliction and that they themselves are worthy of worship and so on and who completely prevent others from generating afflictions that focus on them.üîΩ
